Hello SVS Seniors and Parents,
The SVS PTO is sponsoring portraits of the Class of 2020!

Here are the details:

- Graduates will have their portraits taken by professional portrait photographer and Shepaug parent Melissa Wilson of MW Photography.

- We plan to use the photos as part of the commencement ceremony so we really want photos of every graduate!

- Wear your cap and gown.

- Photos will be taken at Washington’s Bryan Memorial Town Hall.

- Sign up for a photo shoot time slot this Saturday, May 23rd 3:00-7:00pm; Monday, May 25th 10:00am-2:00pm; or Saturday, May 30th 3:00-7:00pm.

- Please arrive for your 10-minute time slot 15 minutes early.

- There is no cost for the photo shoot and digital downloads are free, though donations will be accepted.

- To sign up and for more details, follow the link below. Parents and students, please communicate so that you only sign up for one slot per student:

https://bit.ly/SVS_Commencement_Portrait

- Please spread the word to your friends and classmates so that we get photos of every graduate!

Celebrating the Class of 2020!!
Shepaug has purchased a personalized lawn sign for each senior that will be placed in front of their home. The First Selectmen purchased a personalized sign for each senior in their town that will be placed in front of each town hall.
Last night the PTO announced lawn signs are available for the community to purchase. They have set-up a website to process the orders. Each sign is $5, printed two sides and comes with a metal stand.

The PTO's signs are a way to show support for our seniors. Anyone wishing to purchase signs can do so through the link to the PTO webstore: https://bit.ly/shepaugproudstore.
To reduce handling, the PTO will be fulfilling orders from one location - SVS from 10A - 1P on Saturday, May 30th, most likely at the foot of the driveway. We ask families to stay in their cars, pull up, give their name and they'll be given their signs.

Support the Class of 2020

Shepaug Dramatics is proud to bring Little Shop of Horrors to the stage at Shepaug Valley School from Friday, March 13 through Sunday March 15.

This musical sci-fi comedy centers around Seymour, a down-on-his-luck florist who has a crush on his co-worker Audrey. When they discover a mysterious – and voracious – alien plant, Seymour and Audrey are thrust into an epic battle that will determine the fate of the entire human race.

All performances will take place in the theater at Shepaug Valley School, 159 South Street, Washington, CT 06793. Evening performances take place Friday March 13th and Saturday March 14th at 7:00 PM. A matinee performance is scheduled for Sunday, March 15th at 3:00 PM.

General admission tickets are $10. Tickets for students, senior citizens, and veterans are $5. Tickets can be reserved by calling 860-717-2444 and purchased at the door.

All proceeds will be used to support future productions of Shepaug Dramatics.

“Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.”
— Margaret Mead

The quote that a visitor to the Simply Smiles website first sees, was Maya’s inspiration for her senior project. Last summer students and staff from SVS once again returned to Oaxaca Mexico under the supervision of experienced facilitator-Michael Nolan, Spanish teacher at SVS.

Volunteering to help children who are less fortunate and being able to witness the appreciative smiles and gratitude felt by the children of Oaxaca deeply impacted Maya. Next Friday Shepaug will be putting on the fall play, Outward Bound.

The cast and crew has been working tirelessly to bring the period piece to the stage. Originally written in 1923, Sutton Vane’s self produced story was a surprise hit. The original financiers were fearful of the mix of darkly magical elements along with realistic human drama, but Vane persisted, trusting his own instincts that audiences would be fascinated by the plot and the way each character’s lives are transformed after they appear on the mysterious cruise and are altered as the weird series of events flips their notions of life and death on it’s head.

The production features nine castmembers from grade nine through twelve. The team behind and in front of the curtain are a talented group and are extremely delighted to bring you this fantastical story.

Outward Bound will be performed Friday, November 22nd and 23rd at 7pm & November 24th at 3pm.
